hero.title: Unite Your Community for EV Charging
hero.subtitle: Connect with neighbors in Vilnius apartment buildings to advocate for electric vehicle charging infrastructure together.

howItWorks.title: How It Works
howItWorks.subtitle: Join the movement to bring EV charging to your building in three simple steps.

step1.title: Find Your Location
step1.description: Search for your apartment building address in Vilnius and see if others are already discussing EV charging.

step2.title: Connect with Neighbors
step2.description: Join existing discussions or start a new forum post to connect with residents who share your interest in EV charging.

step3.title: Take Action Together
step3.description: Collaborate with your neighbors to present a unified case to building management or local authorities.

about.title: About Chargington
about.subtitle: Empowering Vilnius residents to bring electric vehicle charging infrastructure to their apartment buildings.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description: Chargington was created to solve a common problem: individual apartment residents struggle to convince building management to install EV charging stations. By connecting neighbors and providing a platform for collective action, we make it easier to demonstrate demand and coordinate efforts.

values.title: Our Values
values.description: We believe in the power of community, sustainable transportation, and making Vilnius a greener city. Every voice matters, and together we can accelerate the transition to electric mobility in our city.

share.title: Share & Connect
share.description: Create posts about your building's EV charging needs and connect with neighbors who share your goals.

discover.title: Discover Nearby
discover.description: Use our interactive map to find other buildings in your area working on similar initiatives.

action.title: Take Action
action.description: Coordinate with your community to present a unified proposal to building management or local authorities.

cta.title: Join the Movement
cta.description: Whether you already own an EV or are planning to make the switch, Chargington helps you take the first step toward charging infrastructure in your building.

about.contact: Questions or suggestions? Contact us at

footer.description: Connecting Vilnius residents to advocate for EV charging infrastructure in apartment buildings.

acceptance.title: 1. Acceptance of Terms
acceptance.content: By accessing and using Chargington ("the Service"), you accept and agree to be bound by the terms and provisions of this agreement. If you do not agree to these terms, please do not use the Service.

description.title: 2. Description of Service
description.content: Chargington provides a community forum platform for residents of apartment buildings in Vilnius, Lithuania to discuss, organize, and advocate for electric vehicle (EV) charging infrastructure. The Service includes forum discussions, interactive maps, and community coordination tools.

accounts.title: 3. User Accounts and Registration
accounts.intro: To access certain features of the Service, you must register for an account. When registering, you agree to:
items: Provide accurate, current, and complete information
Maintain and promptly update your account information
Maintain the security of your password and account
Accept responsibility for all activities under your account
Notify us immediately of any unauthorized use of your account

conduct.title: 4. User Content and Conduct
conduct.intro: You are responsible for all content you post on the Service. You agree not to post content that:
items: Is false, misleading, or fraudulent
Infringes on intellectual property rights
Contains hate speech, harassment, or threats
Violates privacy rights or shares personal information without consent
Contains spam, advertising, or promotional content without authorization
Violates any applicable laws or regulations

address.title: 5. Address Information
address.content: By providing your building address, you acknowledge that this information may be displayed on public maps and forum posts. You should only provide addresses where you are a legitimate resident or have permission to represent. False address information may result in account termination.

ip.title: 6. Intellectual Property
ip.content: The Service and its original content, features, and functionality are owned by Chargington and are protected by international copyright, trademark, and other intellectual property laws. User-generated content remains the property of the respective users, but by posting, you grant Chargington a license to use, display, and distribute that content within the Service.

warranty.title: 7. Disclaimer of Warranties
warranty.content: The Service is provided "as is" and "as available" without warranties of any kind, either express or implied. Chargington does not guarantee that the Service will be uninterrupted, secure, or error-free. We do not warrant the accuracy or completeness of information provided by users.

liability.title: 8. Limitation of Liability
liability.content: Chargington shall not be liable for any indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or punitive damages resulting from your use of or inability to use the Service. This includes damages for loss of profits, data, or other intangible losses.

modifications.title: 9. Modifications to Service
modifications.content: We reserve the right to modify or discontinue the Service at any time, with or without notice. We shall not be liable to you or any third party for any modification, suspension, or discontinuance of the Service.

law.title: 10. Governing Law
law.content: These Terms shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the Republic of Lithuania, without regard to its conflict of law provisions. Any disputes arising from these Terms or the Service shall be subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of Vilnius, Lithuania.

contact.title: 11. Contact Information
contact.content: If you have any questions about these Terms, please contact us at: info@Chargington.lt

intro.title: 1. Introduction
intro.content: Chargington ("we", "our", or "us") is committed to protecting your privacy. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, disclose, and safeguard your information when you use our community forum platform. This policy complies with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and Lithuanian data protection laws.

personal.title: 2.1 Personal Information
personal.intro: When you register for an account, we collect:
items: Full name
Email address
Building address in Vilnius
Password (encrypted)

content.title: 2.2 Content Information
content.intro: When you use the Service, we collect:
items: Forum posts and replies
Comments and interactions
Location data when you select addresses on maps

technical.title: 2.3 Technical Information
items: IP address
Browser type and version
Device information
Usage data and analytics

use.title: 3. How We Use Your Information
items: Provide and maintain the Service
Display your posts and profile information to other users
Show building locations on public maps
Send you service-related notifications
Improve and optimize the Service
Detect and prevent fraud or abuse

sharing.title: 4. Information Sharing and Disclosure
items: Publicly: Your name, building address, and forum posts are visible to all users
With service providers: We may use third-party services for hosting, analytics, and email delivery
For legal reasons: We may disclose information if required by law or to protect our rights
sharing.note: We do not sell your personal information to third parties.

rights.title: 5. Your Rights (GDPR)
rights.intro: Under GDPR, you have the right to:
items: Access your personal data
Rectify inaccurate data
Request deletion of your data ("right to be forgotten")
Object to processing of your data
Data portability
Withdraw consent at any time
rights.contact: To exercise these rights, contact us at: privacy@Chargington.lt

security.title: 6. Data Security
security.content: We implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect your personal data. However, no method of transmission over the Internet is 100% secure, and we cannot guarantee absolute security.

retention.title: 7. Data Retention
retention.content: We retain your personal information for as long as your account is active or as needed to provide the Service. You may request deletion of your account at any time, after which we will delete or anonymize your data within 30 days, except where retention is required by law.

children.title: 8. Children's Privacy
children.content: The Service is not intended for users under 16 years of age. We do not knowingly collect personal information from children under 16.

changes.title: 9. Changes to This Policy
changes.content: We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new policy on this page and updating the "Last updated" date.

contact.title: 10. Contact Us
contact.content: If you have questions about this Privacy Policy, please contact us at: privacy@Chargington.lt

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Find answers to common questions about Chargington and EV charging in apartment buildings.

questions.a: Chargington is a community platform that connects residents of apartment buildings in Vilnius who want to advocate for electric vehicle (EV) charging infrastructure. We help neighbors find each other, share experiences, and coordinate efforts to bring charging stations to their buildings.

Yes, Chargington is completely free to use. We believe that access to sustainable transportation infrastructure should be available to everyone, and our platform helps make that possible through community coordination.

Anyone living in an apartment building in Vilnius, Lithuania can use Chargington. Whether you already own an electric vehicle or are planning to purchase one, you can join the community and start connecting with your neighbors.

questions.q: What types of EV charging stations are suitable for apartment buildings?
questions.a: Most apartment buildings install Level 2 (AC) charging stations, which typically provide 7-22 kW of power. These can fully charge most EVs overnight. The specific type depends on your building's electrical capacity, parking setup, and budget. Common solutions include wall-mounted chargers in individual parking spots or shared charging stations in common areas.

questions.q: How much does it cost to install EV charging in an apartment building?
questions.a: Costs vary significantly based on several factors: the number of charging points, electrical infrastructure upgrades needed, parking layout, and chosen equipment. A single charging point can cost â‚¬1,500-â‚¬5,000, while comprehensive building-wide solutions may cost â‚¬20,000-â‚¬100,000+. Many buildings start with a pilot project of 2-5 charging points. EU and Lithuanian government grants may be available to offset costs.

questions.q: Does our building need electrical upgrades?
questions.a: It depends on your building's current electrical capacity and how many charging stations you plan to install. A professional electrical assessment is recommended. Many modern buildings can accommodate several charging points with minimal upgrades, while older buildings may need significant electrical work. Load management systems can help optimize existing capacity.

questions.q: Do I need permission from my building management?
questions.a: Yes, in most cases you will need approval from your building's homeowners association (HOA) or management company. The approval process varies, but typically requires presenting a proposal at a homeowners meeting. Having multiple interested residents (which Chargington helps you find) strengthens your case significantly.

questions.q: What are the legal requirements in Lithuania?
questions.a: Lithuanian law (Law on Construction, Building Technical Regulation STR 1.01.03:2017) requires new residential buildings to have infrastructure for EV charging. For existing buildings, Lithuanian Civil Code allows homeowners to request modifications for EV charging, but requires majority approval from the HOA. The Building Management Law outlines the decision-making process.

questions.q: Can I install a charging station just for my parking spot?
questions.a: In most cases, yes, but you still need HOA approval even for a private installation. You'll typically need to: 1) Get electrical capacity assessment, 2) Present plans to HOA, 3) Get majority vote approval, 4) Hire certified electrician, 5) Cover all costs yourself. However, coordinating with neighbors (via Chargington) can lead to better, more cost-effective solutions for everyone.

questions.q: How many neighbors do I need to start an EV charging initiative?
questions.a: While one person can propose the idea, having 3-5 interested residents significantly increases your chances of success. This shows real demand and makes the cost-per-resident more attractive. Chargington helps you find these neighbors in your building.

questions.q: What are the typical steps to get EV charging installed?
questions.a: 1) Find interested neighbors (use Chargington!), 2) Get electrical capacity assessment, 3) Obtain quotes from installation companies, 4) Prepare proposal with costs and timeline, 5) Present to HOA meeting, 6) Get majority vote approval, 7) Sign contracts and begin installation, 8) Typically takes 3-12 months total.

questions.q: How do I convince skeptical neighbors?
questions.a: Focus on: 1) Future-proofing the building (EV adoption is growing rapidly), 2) Increasing property values, 3) No cost to non-EV owners if users pay for installation and electricity, 4) Environmental benefits, 5) Share success stories from other buildings (found in Chargington forum).

guidelines.title: Community Guidelines
guidelines.subtitle: Help us maintain a respectful, helpful, and productive community for all members.
guidelines.intro: Chargington is built on the principle of neighbors helping neighbors. These guidelines ensure our community remains welcoming, constructive, and focused on our shared goal of bringing EV charging infrastructure to Vilnius apartment buildings.

respect.title: Be Respectful and Constructive
items: Treat all community members with respect, regardless of their EV ownership status or technical knowledge
Disagree politely and focus on ideas, not personal attacks
Remember that everyone is here to solve the same problem - making EV charging accessible
Use appropriate language and avoid inflammatory or offensive content

helpful.title: Be Helpful and Share Knowledge
items: Share your experiences, both successes and failures - others can learn from both
Provide specific details when discussing costs, timelines, and service providers
If you see a question you can answer, take a moment to help
Update your posts when situations change or are resolved
Credit others' ideas and contributions

accurate.title: Keep Information Accurate
items: Only post about buildings where you are a resident or have permission to represent
Provide accurate addresses and contact information
Clearly distinguish between facts, opinions, and speculation
Correct any mistakes in your posts if you discover errors
Don't spread misinformation about costs, regulations, or technical requirements

privacy.title: Respect Privacy
items: Don't share others' personal information (names, phone numbers, apartment numbers) without permission
Be aware that your posts are public and associated with your building address
Don't post photos of people without their consent
Respect the privacy of building management and service providers

ontopic.title: Stay On Topic
items: Keep discussions focused on EV charging infrastructure and related topics
Avoid general political debates, religious discussions, or off-topic conversations
If you want to discuss other building issues, do so in appropriate channels
Don't post spam, advertisements, or promotional content unless explicitly relevant

legal.title: Follow Laws and Regulations
items: Don't encourage or discuss illegal activities
Respect intellectual property and copyright
Don't share copyrighted documents without permission
Follow all applicable Lithuanian and EU laws
When in doubt about legal matters, recommend consulting a lawyer rather than providing legal advice

reporting.title: Reporting Violations
reporting.description: If you see content that violates these guidelines, please report it to our moderation team at: moderation@Chargington.lt. Include a link to the post and a brief description of the issue.

consequences.title: Consequences of Violations
consequences.description: Violations of these guidelines may result in: warnings, temporary suspension, or permanent account termination, depending on severity and frequency. We aim to educate first, but serious violations (harassment, hate speech, illegal content) will result in immediate removal.

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.subtitle: Get in touch with the Chargington team. We're here to help!
contact.intro: Have questions, suggestions, or need assistance? We'd love to hear from you.

general.label: General Inquiries
general.description: For general questions about the platform, partnerships, or media inquiries

support.label: Technical Support
support.description: For help with your account, technical issues, or bug reports

privacy.label: Privacy & Data
privacy.description: For questions about privacy, data protection, or GDPR requests

moderation.label: Content Moderation
moderation.description: To report inappropriate content or guideline violations

social.title: Social Media
social.description: Follow us for updates, success stories, and community highlights

response.title: Response Time
response.description: We aim to respond to all inquiries within 48 hours during business days (Monday-Friday). For urgent technical issues, please include "URGENT" in your email subject line.

faq.title: Before You Contact Us
faq.description: Many common questions are answered in our FAQ section. Check there first - you might find your answer immediately!

feedback.title: Feedback & Suggestions
feedback.description: We're constantly working to improve Chargington. If you have ideas for new features, improvements, or partnerships, we'd love to hear them. Email us at info@Chargington.lt with "Feature Suggestion" in the subject line.

aiConsultant.subtitle: Get personalized recommendations for your EV charging needs
aiConsultant.description: Our AI assistant analyzes your location and nearby forum discussions to provide tailored advice on whether to join existing initiatives or start a new one.
aiConsultant.welcome: Hi! I'm your Chargington AI Consultant. I can help you determine the best course of action for bringing EV charging to your building.
aiConsultant.promptToStart: Share your building's address to get started, and I'll analyze nearby discussions and provide personalized recommendations.

documents.title: EV Charging Station Documents
documents.subtitle: Automatically generate all required legal documents for installing an EV charging station at your property. Save time and avoid errors.

info.title: Fast & Legally Compliant
info.description: All documents comply with Lithuanian legal requirements. Complete the form in 5 minutes and get your documents ready.

personal.title: Personal Information
personal.description: Provide your contact details and identification information

property.title: Property Information
property.description: Tell us about your property and ownership status

parking.title: Parking Information
parking.description: Provide details about where the charging station will be installed
parking.spotNumberOptional: Optional - leave blank if you don't have a specific spot number

charger.title: Charging Station Parameters
charger.description: Specify the technical details of your charging station
charger.powerRecommendation: ðŸ’¡ 11 kW is recommended for home use

installer.title: Installer Selection
installer.description: Choose a certified installer for your charging station
installer.priceNote: The price is automatically calculated based on your selected parameters: station power, number of connectors, property type, and installation method.
installer.noteDescription: Once we receive your documents, we will contact the selected installer and provide them with your contact information and project details.
installer.contactDescription: After receiving your documents, we will forward your information to the selected installer, who will contact you regarding installation details and exact pricing.

documents.title: Co-Owner Consent
documents.coOwnerConsent: Do you already have co-owner consent?
documents.needsTemplate: âŒ No, I need a template
documents.hasConsentDescription: Required: Meeting protocol or written consents from all co-owners (Civil Code Art. 4.75)
documents.needsTemplateDescription: You will receive: (1) Co-owner consent form, (2) Meeting protocol template
documents.houseDescription: Private houses don't require co-owner consent. Click 'Generate Documents'!

result.title: Documents Generated!
result.subtitle: Congratulations, {name}! Your documents are ready.
result.installerDescription: We will contact this company regarding installation
result.contactNote: We will contact them for you
result.contactNoteDescription: Once we receive your documents, we will forward your information to the installer, who will contact you regarding installation details.
result.documentsDescription: Your complete document package is ready to download
result.applicationDescription: Request to building owners or notification
result.downloadError: Error generating PDF. Please try again.
result.nextStepsDescription: Follow these steps to complete your installation
result.step1Description: Use the template in the PDF. Collect all co-owner signatures or call a general meeting. Time: 1-4 weeks.

doc1.title: Application for EV Charging Station Installation
doc1.requestHouse: I INFORM ABOUT THE INTENTION TO INSTALL:
doc1.requestTextApartment: An electric vehicle charging station at parking space No. {spot}, located {location}.
doc1.requestTextHouse: An electric vehicle charging station on my property, located {location}.
doc1.commitment1: Comply with all construction and electrical safety requirements
doc1.commitment2: Use only certified and new equipment
doc1.commitment3: Commission installation works to certified contractor with VERT certificate
doc1.commitment4: Properly operate and maintain the installed station
doc1.commitment5: Compensate for damage to common objects, if any

doc2.consentText: We, the undersigned apartment and premises owners, CONSENT to {name}, owner of apartment No. {apt}, installing an electric vehicle charging station at parking space No. {spot}.
doc2.condition1: Station will be installed according to construction and electrical requirements
doc2.condition2: Only certified and new equipment will be used
doc2.condition3: Works will be performed by certified contractor with VERT certificate
doc2.condition4: ESO connection conditions will be obtained and fulfilled
doc2.condition5: Applicant commits to compensate for damage, if any
doc2.note: NOTE: According to Civil Code (Article 4.75), consent of ALL owners is required.

doc3.step1Text: Use the template in this PDF (Document #2). Collect all co-owner signatures or call a general meeting and confirm the decision by protocol. Time: 1-4 weeks.
doc3.step3Online: Online: www.eso.lt > Services > New object connection
